Package controller

Interface CloseablePropertyChangeListener

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
ProjectCommentController, ProjectDetailsController, ProjectFilterController, ProjectStatusController, ProjectTableController, TeamListController, TeamMembersController, TeamSettingsController
public interface CloseablePropertyChangeListener
extends java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
CloseablePropertyChangeListener is an extension of PropertyChangeListener, intended to solve the problem of memory leaks caused by the listeners: if a listener is registered for an observable, as long as it is not unregistered, the garbage collector will not collect it due to the remaining reference to it in the PropertyChangeObservable's listener list.

To solve this issue, whenever the CloseableComponent corresponding to a CloseablePropertyChangeListener is closed, it closes the CloseablePropertyChangeListener, which will thus be removed from the listener list of the observables, so that the garbage collector can successfully collect it.

Author:
Bori Fazakas

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default void close()
    When closed, the CloseablePropertyChangeListener will be unregistered from the observables.
    java.util.List<PropertyChangeObservable> getPropertyChangeObservables()  
    default void setObservables()
    After constructing a CloseablePropertyChangeListener, it must be registered at the Observables as a listener.

    Methods inherited from interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener

    propertyChange
